pullRequest.title: [BEAM-9468] Fhir io
pullRequest.bodyText:
adds FhirIO healthcare connector
Write use the executeBundle REST API method to execute transactions on the FHIR Store
Read with read / search / from notification subscription
Follow up to #1151
R: @pabloem
CC: @lastomato, @brianlucier
Thank you for your contribution! Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

 Choose reviewer(s) and mention them in a comment (R: @username).
 Format the pull request title like [BEAM-XXX] Fixes bug in ApproximateQuantiles, where you replace BEAM-XXX with the appropriate JIRA issue, if applicable. This will automatically link the pull request to the issue.
 Update CHANGES.md with noteworthy changes.
 If this contribution is large, please file an Apache Individual Contributor License Agreement.

See the Contributor Guide for more tips on how to make review process smoother.

commit.message: call spliterator directly, use page size 1000
output elements more eagerly in ListHL72MessageFn
eagerly emit data from early pages

Optimization of Listing and Stablization of ITs

* allow HL7v2 Message listing to emit early panes rather than waiting on pagination of all list results
* add EBO on HL7v2 Message listing reaching a certain expected length in ITs to account for async indexing BEAM-9779

nodes.bodyText: Is there any specific reason that the input is HttpBody instead of String? It feels weird to me because we only use the data field in the API client.

commit.message: Add constant for HL7v2 indexing timeout minutes
Add constant for HL7v2 indexing timeout minutes
add TODO for verifying triggering behavior BEAM-9847
remove inappropriate 'optimizaiton', add status code to HealthcareIOError
Merge branch 'optimization/HL7v2IO' of github.com:jaketf/beam into optimization/HL7v2IO
refactor Fhir to use String, add status code for apache http client lib errors
fix FHIR resource reading to use object mapper

nodes.bodyText: should this be warn or info?
Consider adding ValueProvider support for temp and deadletter paths.
move this above ImportFn
use a path joining method to handle trailing slash, etc.
is import method idempotent?
what happens if this gets rescheduled.

commit.message:
Clean up based on offline review feedback

* Add SDK version to user agent
* Improve naming of FetchString
* Add value provider support
Merge branch 'FhirIO' of github.com:jaketf/beam into FhirIO

Refactors Import to Copy and Clean Up

* Uses copy instead of rename in FhirIO.ImportFn to be more resilient to rescheduling
* adds .of() static methods for all coders
* make FhirIO.Import extend FhirIO.Write and return both body and file failures
improving coder interface and safety of FhirIO.Import

nodes.bodyText: How come you're taking an input class coder and ignoring it?
Also add a line item about FhirIO to CHANGES.md in the root of apache/beam

You may be able to make tempDir optional by using the tempLocation pipeline option internally. You can leave this for later, as it would be a backwards-compatible change to add a new factory method. does this need to be public?

this function makes RPCs to an external service one-by-one. This will be slow. It may be worth buffering these requests, and applying them with a thread pool. You can add this optimization later on, though.
This may not need to be public?

as mentioned before, you may be able to have a constructor without gcsTempPath

TODO(@pabloem) take a look at this function

This is executing a single RPC per element, right? This will likely be slow, and lead to underutilization of worker resources. As a follow up, messages could be buffered, and RPCs issued via a thread pool
Howcome you receive a class but ignore it?

commit.message: avoid exposing apache http dep in api
copy test resources for dataflow ITs
fix value provider implementation for FhirIO
add HL7v2IO and FhirIO, test dependency issue
nvm spotless apply didn't like that

scaffolding of Read integration test

scaffolding of Read integration test

Refactor to use HL7v2Message wrapper class

* Expose schematized data as JSON string to support motivating use case of
HL7v2 -> FHIR via HCLS DataHamonization Mapping Engine.
* The healthcare model Message class has fields
(namely ParsedData and PatientIds) that are difficult to deal with in the Coder
and provide little value for users.
refactor list fn to avoid double get, improve tests, extract json from schematized data
add IT for new ListHL7v2Messages PTransform
migration to latest beta client library

Revert "remove FhirIO"

This reverts commit d6967914e10da1bf42815573b567cfff564d71a1.

fhir write

wip

wip fhirio
Add convenience function for writing deadletter to bigquery

Address review feedback

* Fix FetchHL7v2Message javadoc
* Add observedTime to HealthcareIOErrorCoder
ephemeral HL7v2 stores in integration tests
workaround broken executeBundle in client library
separate ITs for all fhir versions

nodes.bodyText:
@lastomato @yeweidaniel @ygupta89 @pabloem
Please review the logic here and LMK if you feel this is spamming the import API.
As written this will create a separate new line delimited JSON file per bundle (group of elements in a PCollection of arbitrary size decided by runner) and import it w/ a separate call to import API.
This was the "easiest" way to implement but may not be the most appropriate usage of the import API.
PTAL and LMK if you'd like this to refactored into something that:

asserts bounded PCollection
waits til all temp files are written
blocks on import by polling the operation til complete.

It's not immediately obvious to me how to achieve 1 & 2 in the beam framework but I can do some research.

@lastomato @yeweidaniel @ygupta89
This is super awkward but the executeBundle method of client lib seems broken always giving errors about unparsable resource based on my testing (CDAP plugins also written similar to this).
Any ETA on fix for that?
Does this workaround seem acceptable til then?

commit.message: DRY up GCS clean up in util
fix merge issue w/ duplicate google_oauth_clients_version
parameterize write ITs add scaffolidng for Read IT
add TODO to add support for batch API in the future once available
add reshuffle to increase downstream paralelism
add GroupIntoBatches logic to FhirIO.Import to write more resources to files
add GroupIntoBatches test for uneven batches

Refactor FhirIO.Import

This commit is the first in a series of explorations of best method
for batching files to a single GCS prefix for fhirStores.import call.

FhirIO.Import now follow the algorithm of:
- Write Bundles of input PCollection<HttpBody> to GCS
- GroupByKey (random key to parallelize GroupIntoBatches)
- GroupIntoBatches (of 10,000 files)
- move each batch of files to uniquely named GCS path
- make import calls for each of these GCS paths
fix auto value issue causing canot find symbol

Patches for HL7v2IO

* Use TestPipeline in ITs
* Drop schematized data before calling message ingest (should be output only) to help pipelines that read/write from/to two HL7v2 stores
* Make HL7v2MessageCoder constructor public
add sleep to avoid flakiness due to asyncronous HL7v2 indexing
